results.title: Mobility
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Barrie Howells and Roger Hart
results.brief_description: Examines the complex range of problems involved in Third World urban transport, from cost and available technology to the different needs of the industrialized middle class and the urban poor, and proposes some surprising solutions. This film explores how transportation planners and city governments try to solve the problems associated with the growth of cities, especially the increased pressure on existing transportation systems.

results.title: Mobil movielogue. No. 10
results.brief_description: Documentary film about the various uses of petroleum. Features the Fisherman’s Bend Commonwealth Aircraft factory; shows the manufacturing and testing of Rolls Royce jet engines as used in RAAF Vampire aircraft; the Rover gas turbine car on test tracks; launch of petrol tanker; Altona Refinery opening; Army petrol driven vehicles; speed boats on Sydney Harbour; Bathurst - Mount Panorama circuit in action.

results.title: Moana Roa
results.brief_description: Life among the Polynesian people who inhabit New Zealand’s Cook Islands. The sea plays an important part in the lives of these people; they are expert spear fisherman and gain much of their food from the sea; singing and dancing and also canoe racing are popular pastimes with the islanders. The film reviews health and educational services provided by the administration and mentions the exports of the Islands - copra, oranges, bananas and pineapples.

results.title: Mo' better blues
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks and Spike Lee
results.brief_description: Award winning actor Denzel Washington gives a rivetting performance in Spike Lee’s breathtaking film about music and love. Talented trumpeter, (Washington), is obsessed by his music and is indecisive about his girlfriends Indigo and Clarke. When he is forced to come to the aid of his manager and childhood friend (Spike Lee), Bleek finds his world more fragile than he ever imagined. Stunning cinematography, a rousing score and superlative performances combine in an unforgettable feast of the senses. Also stars John Turturro and Wesley Snipes.

results.title: Mixing solutions
results.brief_description: Looks at safety measures to adopt when mixing chemical herbicides in a farming situation. Gives sound advice in an easily followed format.

results.title: Mixed blood
results.creator_credit: Sara Films, Antoine Gannage, Steven Fierberg and Paul Morrissey
results.brief_description: Morrissey’s post-Warhol feature film about gang violence in New York’s Alphabet City. Marilia Pera is outstanding as the Brazilian leader of the Mercentanos gang. She is a drug-dealer and pimp, but also mother to a group of teenage boys who obey her every command, be it shooting a rival or doing the laundry. “Mixed Blood” is violent and disturbing but it maintains a comic tone throughout that refuses sentimentality and cliche. This is a drug “exploitation” movie scored to a festive, breezy Latin beat.

results.title: Mitosis: how cells divide and multiply
results.creator_credit: CSIRO, A.S. Fraser and D.G. Perrin
results.brief_description: Uses simple animation to show the essential changes in the nucleus leading up to its division into two daughter cells. Explains why each daughter cell contains the same number of chromosomes as the parent cell.
results.description: Uses simple animation to show the essential changes in the nucleus leading up to its division into two daughter cells. Explains why each daughter cell contains the same number of chromosomes as the parent cell.

results.title: Mitosis. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and William L. Claiborne
results.brief_description: Defines the cellular process of mitosis. Identifies and illustrates the role of the cell nucleus, DNA, chromosomes, chromatids and the centriole in mitosis. Demonstrates the phases of mitosis and explains what happens during each phase. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Mitosis and mitotic poisons = Mitose und mitosegifte
results.creator_credit: Institut für Film und Bild and Professor H Lette
results.brief_description: Cultures are grown from the heart of a chicken embryo and the behaviour of the original and subcultures is shown. The process of cell division is photographed at a magnification of 250 and in more detail using oil-immersion at a magnification of 900. The inhibition of mitosis by the presence in the culture medium of various substances is studied. The action which inhibits mitosis varies from an adhesion of the chromosomes which are attempting to divide in the presence of trypaflavin to an explosion of the cells attempting division in the presence of adrenalin. Captions in German.

results.title: Misty
results.brief_description: Two young children living with their grandparents see a wild horse and they become enchanted. Like a dream, this horse runs with the wind and belongs to the wild. Obsessed with the thought of owning the horse, the children battle against all odds. When their dream comes true the horse will show them an adventure of love and freedom they had never thought possible.
